abstract: New York Gov Andrew Cuomo announces special elections to fill 11th Congressional District seat, vacated by disgraced Rep Michael G Grimm, and State Assembly seat vacated when Assemblyman Karim Camara accepted another post.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo set balloting for May 5 to pick the successor to former Representative Michael G. Grimm, who pleaded guilty to tax evasion, and for an Assembly vacancy.

headline.main: Cuomo Sets Special Election to Fill Grimm’s Seat
headline.print_headline: Special Vote Is Set to Fill Seat Vacated by Grimm

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo set balloting for May 5 to pick the successor to former Representative Michael G. Grimm, who pleaded guilty to tax evasion, and for an Assembly vacancy.
